old_regulations.summary: Securities and Commodities Authority framework for crypto asset activities, requiring licensing of exchanges and custodians, AML/CFT compliance, and investor protection measures. Penalties up to AED 10 million.
Abu Dhabi Global Market framework for digital asset regulation including spot crypto assets, requiring licensing, conduct of business rules, and technology governance standards.
Central Bank guidance on anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing for virtual asset service providers, including customer due diligence and suspicious transaction reporting requirements.

new_regulations.summary: Requires all stablecoin issuers and traders in UAE to obtain VARA licensing. Mandates AED-denominated reserve audits quarterly, bans privacy coins (Monero, ZCash), and introduces geo-fencing requirements for non-UAE IP addresses. Penalties up to AED 20 million.

amount_based: Transaction amount > 3× user's historical average (violates basic AML thresholds under SCA regulation)
Daily total amount > 2× user's usual daily total
Single transaction exceeding AED 55,000 (~$15,000) requires enhanced due diligence
frequency_based: Transactions per day > 2× user's normal frequency
More than 8 transactions in a single day triggers review
location_based: Transaction from a new country not seen in history
Rapid country switching within short time (geo-hopping)
Transactions from FATF grey-list or sanctioned jurisdictions
behavioural_pattern: Inconsistent behaviour vs declared profile (e.g., high volume from low-activity history)
Sudden shift to privacy coins (Monero, ZCash) from standard tokens
Round-number transactions suggesting structuring or layering

rules.rule: Impossible geo hop (actual time < min travel time)
